6340.text: after the fatigues of the evening, we parted.

6342.text:
It was between twelve and
one o'clock when I reached the Temple, and

6349.text:
No one
was near me when I went in and went home.

6353.text:
Herbert had come in, and we held a very serious
council by the fire.

6356.text:
But
there was nothing to be done, saving to communicate

6360.text:
to Wemmick what I
had that night found out, and to remind him

6364.text: that we waited for his hint.

6367.text:
As I thought that I might compromise him if
I went too often to the

6370.text: Castle, I made this communication by letter.

6374.text:
I wrote it before I went to
bed, and went out and posted it; and again

6381.text:
Herbert
and I agreed that we could do nothing else

6386.text:
And
we were very cautious indeed,—more cautious

6389.text:
than before, if that were
possible,—and I for my part never went near

6394.text:
Chinks's Basin, except
when I rowed by, and then I only looked at

6398.text:
Mill Pond Bank as I looked at
anything else.
